meanings.definition: The underworld in Greek mythology where the souls of the dead reside.
meanings.sent1: In Greek myths, souls go to hades after they die.
meanings.sent2: Many ancient stories mention hades as the realm of the dead.
meanings.sent3: When the hero visited hades, he met many famous spirits.
meanings.sent4: The idea of hades as a shadowy realm captures the imagination.
meanings.sent5: The concept of hades is both mysterious and eerie.

meanings.definition: A place or state of suffering or torment.
meanings.sent1: The soldier endured hades during the battle.
meanings.sent2: She described the haunted house as a real hades.
meanings.sent3: Trying to assemble the furniture was a complete hades.
meanings.sent4: The traffic jam was a hades of honking horns and exhaust fumes.
meanings.sent5: The exam room felt like a hades of stress and anxiety.

meanings.definition: Used as a euphemism for hell.
meanings.sent1: She warned him that lying would lead straight to hades.
meanings.sent2: The old tales spoke of sinners facing hades in the afterlife.
meanings.sent3: His room was a complete hades with clothes strewn everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The kitchen turned into a hades of burnt pans and smoke.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house was a hades of broken windows and creaking doors.
